intro: Hieracium auroclavatum, commonly known as the golden clubbed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its bright yellow flowers, which bloom in late summer, are surrounded by pale green bracts that give it a distinctive appearance. Hieracium auroclavatum is often found in open habitats and can sometimes form dense colonies.
